reviewText: Geoffrey Baer is the master of the history of Chicago! Geoffrey Barer take you on a gripping journey of tragedy, sorrow, and triumph of what is Chicago's beautiful and history lake front. Stretching from the Indiana dunes all the way to Wilmette, Baer tells you tales of Chicago's great villains as well as its great heroes who's dreams and visions helped shape Chicago into the magnificent masterpiece it is today.
Wonderful story of the Lake Front.

This disc is a DVD-R, not a pressed DVD, which means it costs more than it needs to and it is likely to have quality problems.  WTTW was also thoughtful enough to include the original commercials. :(  This is a shame, because these programs hosted by Geoffrey Baer are wonderful and easily worth five stars. There are terrific extras in the form of episodes from Chicago Stories and the original 1999 production of Chicago's Lakefront.
Geoffrey Baer is a wonderful guide. Love watching his stuff.

The history details were so interesting and the old pictures along with the new made it fascinating.
I love all of Geoffrey Baer's Tours, but this may not be one of my favorites

Geoffrey's expertise, storytelling skills & love for Chicago enhance each tour he provides for us. He is a legend & keeps us up to date with the rich history of Chicago & it's continual growth.
What a wonderful way to enjoy the city & be enticed to visit it.
Wonderful gift for someone who loves Chicago. It is informative without being so heavy in facts that you feel you are in a classroom. My aunt loved it.
